title: Augusta County: Henry H. Dedrick to Mary E. A. Dedrick, January 22, 1862
summary: Dedrick expresses concern about crops back home and wonders whether the men at home are taking advantage of the men serving in the army. He also talks about the possiblity of a furlough.
keywords: Agriculture, Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Family, Home Front, Military Authority, Women, American Civil War
